result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett J Hasbrouck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF81

timeConds.notes: May serve jail in any county.  Defendant must petition court for approval of electronic monitoring.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett J Hasbrouck

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant letting the court know he will not be able to make an appearance in court due to the letter having to be forwarded twice and receiving it so close to court date. Defendant agrees to pay for counseling. Notice of Hearing was sent with the letter.

3:41 PM Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin.  Other Crime Victim Witness in court. Janel appears in court. 
Court reads a letter to the court from the defendant. Crime Victim Witness makes a statement in regards to counseling costs and what the victims mothers thoughts are on this.
Attorney Oswald gives the court a few ideas for procedures regarding restitution payments. Court gives feedback. Crime Victim Witness states a few of her concerns.

11:03 Defendant Brett J Hasbrouck in court, in custody.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brad Swoboda appears by phone as Hasbrouck's probation agent.  Brad Swoboda is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to violations Hasbrouck has committed since he has been on probation.  

Hasbrouck states he has filled out the SORP and sent it out the day after Agent Swoboda saw him.  

Hasbrouck makes a statement regarding his violations.  Court addresses Hasbrouck.

Court denies the defendant's request for huber privileges and reiterates the conditions that are set up for Hasbrouck through probation.
